result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody T McLaughlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber.
Standard release conditions.
If revoked, court grants 6 days credit.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school. Get GED.

No violent contact with the victim.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Attend Anger Management Course.

Cases 15CM1866 and 15CM1689 were both dismissed and read into: 15CM1619.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody T McLaughlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 1/5/16

Defendant Cody T McLaughlin in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant to have no violent contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Defendant to contact the Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of his release with his new address.

Defendant Cody T McLaughlin in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Smith presents bail motion arguments to modify the bail. State presents arguments. Court grants the modification to a no violent contact with the victim. Court adjourns the matter for 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Motion for bail reduction and/or modification
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Defendant may have one trip to the residence with a police officer to obtain personal items.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to contact the Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of his release with his new address.

Defendant Cody T McLaughlin in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
